question: Which country houses the "Santa Ana Volcano"?
explanation: Santa Ana Volcano, also known as Ilamatepec, is an active stratovolcano located in the Cordillera de Apaneca parent mountain range of El Salvador. This volcano is the highest volcano in El Salvador, which is 2381 metres high above sea level. This volcano was behind the inspiration of Antoine de Saint-Exupery's French novella "The Little Prince".
